channel.title: Router appears to block tinypic images
channel.description:
I have a Belkin N series router and this has really began to annoy me, I can't see any images that are posted from tinypic, and as tinypic is used quite a lot around the site it's pretty inconvenient.
I can visit tinypic.com and upload images fine, but when trying to view images, both copying the url into the url bar, and just browsing pages, they just continuously load until an error comes up.
Have no idea why this is, tried on 4 different browsers with no success (chrome, firefox, safari and opera). Also tried on my nokia smartphone with wifi, nothing at all.

item.title: Router appears to block tinypic images
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

A traceroute to the tinypic server of a failed pic and a wireshark dump of the request would be better :>

Read full topic
item.source: Router appears to block tinypic images

item.title: Router appears to block tinypic images
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:382942”][quote author=zachera link=topic=478725.msg3507861#msg3507861 date=1298272967]
Use imgur.
[/quote]

That’s probably not the issue, he wants to see pictures that other people post, and he can’t really force everyone to use another site.[/quote]
Nope. :o
I can however see the images if I then upload the url to imageshack, but this is pretty tedious to do just to view one image, especially when I have possibly the worst internet in England…

Would anyone know of a way around this? If needed I can post my router configuration page, though I’ve had a good look and can’t really see much relevant.

Read full topic
